front.title: IANA registrations of SDP 'proto' attribute for transporting RTP Media over TCP under various RTP profiles.

abstract.t: RTP provides end-to-end network transport functions suitable for applications transmitting real-time data such as audio, video or simulation data, over multicast or unicast network services. The data transport is augmented by a control protocol (RTCP) to allow monitoring of the data delivery in a manner scalable to large multicast networks, and to provide minimal control and identification functionality.

The RTP specification establishes a registry of profile names for use by higher-level control protocols, such as the SDP, to refer to transport methods. This specification describes the following new SDP transport protocol identifiers for transporting RTP Media over TCP:'TCP/RTP/AVPF', 'TCP/RTP/SAVP', 'TCP/RTP/SAVPF', 'TCP/DTLS/RTP/SAVP', 'TCP/DTLS/RTP/SAVPF', 'TCP/TLS/RTP/AVP', 'TCP/TLS/RTP/AVPF', 'TCP/TLS/RTP/SAVP', 'TCP/TLS/RTP/SAVPF'.

section.title: Overview
section.t: SDP provides a general-purpose format for describing multimedia sessions in announcements or invitations. specifies a general mechanism for describing media transport over TCP using SDP with defining a method for framing Real-time Transport Protocol (RTP) and RTP Control Protocol (RTCP) packets onto a connection-oriented transport (such as TCP) . extends for describing TCP-based media streams that are protected using TLS .
This specification describes the following new SDP transport protocol identifiers for transporting RTP Media over TCP:
TCP/RTP/AVPF: to describe RTP Media with RTCP-based Feedback over TCP.
TCP/RTP/SAVP: to describe Secure RTP Media over TCP.
TCP/RTP/SAVPF: to describe Secure RTP Media with RTCP-based Feedback over TCP.
TCP/DTLS/RTP/SAVP: to describe Secure RTP Media using DTLS-SRTP over TCP.
TCP/DTLS/RTP/SAVPF: to describe Secure RTP Media with RTCP-based Feedback using DTLS-SRTP over TCP.
TCP/TLS/RTP/AVP: to describe RTP Media on top of TLS over TCP.
TCP/TLS/RTP/AVPF: to describe RTP Media with RTCP-based Feedback on top of TLS over TCP.
TCP/TLS/RTP/SAVP: to describe Secure RTP Media on top of TLS over TCP.
TCP/TLS/RTP/SAVPF: to describe Secure RTP Media with RTCP-based Feedback on top of TLS over TCP.

section.title: Terminology
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119.

section.title: Protocol Identifier
section.t: The 'm=' line in SDP specifies, among other items, the transport protocol to be used for the media in the session. See the "Media Descriptions" section of SDP for a discussion on transport protocol identifiers.
The following is the format for an 'm=' line, as specified in :
An 'm' line that specifies these new proto identifiers MUST further qualify the application-layer protocol using an fmt identifier.

section.title: TCP/RTP/AVPF Transport Realization
section.t: The TCP/RTP/AVPF is realized as described below:

list.t: RTP/AVPF stream over the TCP transport is realized using the framing method defined in .

section.title: TCP/RTP/SAVP Transport Realization
section.t: The TCP/RTP/SAVP is realized as described below:

list.t: RTP/SAVP stream over the TCP transport is realized using the framing method defined in .

section.title: TCP/RTP/SAVPF Transport Realization
section.t: The TCP/RTP/SAVPF is realized as described below:

list.t: RTP/SAVPF stream over the TCP transport is realized using the framing method defined in .

section.title: TCP/DTLS/RTP/SAVP Transport Realization
section.t: The TCP/DTLS/RTP/SAVP is realized as described below:

list.t: RTP/SAVP on top of DTLS is realized according to the procedures defined in ; and
framing is used to transport DTLS-SRTP packets over TCP.

section.title: TCP/DTLS/RTP/SAVPF Transport Realization
section.t: The TCP/DTLS/RTP/SAVPF is realized as described below:

list.t: RTP/SAVPF on top of DTLS is realized according to the procedures defined in ; and
framing is used to transport DTLS-SRTP packets over TCP.

section.title: TCP/TLS/RTP/AVP Transport Realization
section.t: The TCP/TLS/RTP/AVP is realized as described below:

list.t: RTP/AVP packets framing is realzied using the procedures from .
framed RTP/AVP packets are transported as Application data messages over the TLS association setup using the procedures from .

section.title: TCP/TLS/RTP/AVPF Transport Realization
section.t: The TCP/TLS/RTP/AVPF is realized as described below:

list.t: RTP/AVPF packets framing is realzied using the procedures from .
framed RTP/AVPF packets are transported as Application data messages over the TLS association setup using the procedures from .

section.title: TCP/TLS/RTP/SAVP Transport Realization
section.t: The TCP/TLS/RTP/SAVP is realized as described below:

list.t: procedures are followed for setting up TLS associtation(s) between the peers. Additionally, the cryptographic mechanism used to generate the certificate fingerprint presented in the SDP, MUST be chosen from the SRTPProtectionProfiles as described in .
RTP/SAVP packets are framed according to the procedures from .
framed RTP/SAVP packets are transported as Application data messages over the TLS association setup using the procedures from .

section.title: TCP/TLS/RTP/SAVPF Transport Realization
section.t: The TCP/TLS/RTP/SAVP is realized as described below:

list.t: procedures are followed for setting up TLS associtation(s) between the peers. Additionally, the cryptographic mechanism used to generate the certificate fingerprint presented in the SDP, MUST be chosen from the SRTPProtectionProfiles as described in .
RTP/SAVPF packets are framed according to the procedures from .
framed RTP/SAVP packets are transported as Application data messages over the TLS association setup using the procedures from .

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: This specification describes the following new SDP transport protocol identifiers :'TCP/RTP/AVPF', 'TCP/RTP/SAVP', 'TCP/RTP/SAVPF', 'TCP/DTLS/RTP/SAVP', 'TCP/DTLS/RTP/SAVPF', 'TCP/TLS/RTP/AVP', 'TCP/TLS/RTP/AVPF', 'TCP/TLS/RTP/SAVP', 'TCP/TLS/RTP/SAVPF' as defined in the section . These proto values should be registered by the IANA under:

list.t: "Real-Time Transport Protocol (RTP) Parameters" under "RTP Profile Names" registry

section.t: Additionally the following proto values described in should be registered under the "Real-Time Transport Protocol (RTP) Parameters" under "RTP Profile Names" registry : 'UDP/TLS/RTP/SAVP' , 'DCCP/TLS/RTP/SAVP', 'UDP/TLS/RTP/SAVPF', 'DCCP/TLS/RTP/SAVPF'.

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: The new "proto" identifiers registered by this document in the SDP parameters registry maintained by IANA is primarily for use by the offer/answer model of the Session Description Protocol for the negotiation and establishment of RTP based Media over the TCP transport. These additional SDP "proto" identifiers does not introduce any security considerations beyond those detailed in Section 7 of .

section.title: Acknowledgements
